snippet: More than 62 percent of the continental United States is experiencing moderate to exceptional drought, compared with just over 29 percent at this time last year.
abstract: More than 62 percent of the continental United States is experiencing moderate to exceptional drought, compared with just over 29 percent at same time in 2011; drought is expected to persist in most of dry regions west of the Mississippi River over next three months.

byline.contributor: Steven Yaccino contributed reporting from Chicago and John Schwartz from New York.

lead_paragraph: More than 62 percent of the continental United States is experiencing moderate to exceptional drought, compared with just over 29 percent at this time last year.

headline.main: Season Has Changed, but the Drought Endures
headline.print_headline: Season Has Changed, but the Drought Endures
